alert.note: Alert for Baldwin (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 24 at 8:48PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Alabama, including the following counties, in south central Alabama, Monroe. In southwest Alabama, Baldwin and Clarke. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 844 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the advisory area. Rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2 inches are estimated to have fallen during the past hour. Additional storms will continue to move over the advisory area during the next 1 to 2 hours. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Monroeville, Frisco City, Peterman, Uriah, Barlow Bend, Homewood, Manistee, Perdue Hill, Claiborne, Gainestown, Jeddo, Gosport, Eliska, Palmers Crossroads, Manila, Megargel, Mount Pleasant, Mineola, Alma and Chrysler. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
